titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the American Life Collection
titlestmt.author: compiled by Staff of Manuscripts and Archives

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday December 8, 2018 at 09:57

did.unittitle: American Life collection

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: An artificial collection of correspondence, advertisements, brochures, broadsides, newspapers, magazines, posters, programs, printed material, and miscellanea relating to American life and culture, ca.1824-1952.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: American Life Collection (MS 748). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: The following materials were removed from the collection: exhibition materials transferred to the Exhibitions Collection (MS 893); "Military education in American Colleges," by Colonel Henry B. Carrinton, transferred to the Carrington Family Papers (MS 130); E. Ingraham Co. materials transferred to the University of Connecticut Library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection is made up of miscellaneous manuscript and printed items which, although ephemeral, illuminate in unexpected ways corners of American life. The letters, generally from unidentified writers, reveal something about business methods, education and the life of the times. Farming, mining, land speculation, and the opening up of new territories are some of the subjects discussed in these letters.

Also included are legal and financial documents that record the transfer of offices, the price of land, and the cost of goods and services. Printed matter, usch as land offereings, trade cards, advertisements of various sorts, campaign literature and other ephemera are also included and add to the flavor of the periods covered. Both 19th and 20th century material is included in this collection.

Since the items are arranged by accession in numbered folders, there is no chronological or alphabetical order. Wherever possible, however, the material is grouped by subject. By scanning the subject headings in the register, the researcher can readily locate the topics covered.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright status for collection materials is unknown, though much of the material in this collection is likely in the public domain. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

did.unittitle: Inventory

Letter from E W Mc from Colorado Springs, Colorado to his "old friend," Charles W. Paynter, Springfield, Ohio describing business opportunities and mining operations in Colorado as well as new gold fields in Cripple Creek. 3 p.
AD appointing Hiram M. Dickinson Deputy Clerk of the Supreme Court of the Territory of Nebraska, signed by J.H.Kellom, Clerk of the Court and by Hiram M. Dickinson, with his oath.
Receipt for $5.00 for the repair of a gate. Signed, I.A.Moody.

Certificate issued by the Hungarian Fund for $1, stating that On demand one year after the establishment in fact of the INDEPENDENT HUNGARIAN GOVERNMENT, the holder shall be entitled to one dollar payable at the National Treasury… Illus. Issued at New York.
Letter from H.H.Stoddard for the Poultry World quoting prices for advertising and enclosing samples.
2 concluding pages of a lecture in praise of knowledge which brings "disenthrallment" to Africans, Asians and "the downtrodden of Europe;" and on the Manifest Destiny of the U.S. Author unidentified.
Two letters from "August" to his cousin discussing national policies and family matters.
did.unitdate: 1884 October 22, Angel Island, Cal 1895 June 2, Cincinnati, Ohio.

did.unittitle: ALS from a husband to his wife referring to the unexpected death of their son. Tells of going to the fair at Maryville [California] where he meets George Newcomb with a new "wife." The writer, a salesman of "machines," speculates on the actual marital status of the pair.
ADS by D. Lyman giving "my Small Sword which was my faithful Companion during our revolutionary struggle..." to his son, Thomas.
Religious literature
Hymns sung at the Center Church New Haven at the funeral solemnities on occasion of the death of William Henry Harrison, late President of the United States. 4 p.

The Morning Star. Boston, American Board of Commissioners for Foreign Missions, February 5, 1857. 12 p. illus. Description of the building of The Morning Star, a ship to carry missionaries to Micronesia and maintain communication between the islands. Among the first passengers were the Rev. Hiram Bingham, Jr. and his wife. Donations are listed by state.

Davis, George W. The Fall of the Holy City and What it Portends. Los Angeles Christian and Missionary Alliance, 1918? 17 p. (Timely Topics No.3) A religious interpretation of the capture of Jerusalem by the British in December 1917 as the sign of "the restoration of all things."
S. Rosalia . Engraving showing the saint surrounded by religious symbols. In the background, an episode from her life. 2 copies.
Publishers' advertisements
Little and Brown. Proposals for publishing…Speeches, forensic arguments and diplomatic papers of Daniel Webster. Boston 4 p. folder. (2 copies)
Hogan & Thompson. Books published and offered to the Trade. School books, medical, law, bibles, illustrated books and the Rollo Books. 1 p.
Politics and government

Republican League of the United States. Under which flag? New York, [1888]. Card comparing wages in an English and an American woolen mill, and protesting "any reduction of the duties that will bring us on a level with…Europe."
Barnet, John. An Oration delivered at Amenia in the Union Society, July 4, 1812...to celebrate the birth-day of our republic. Poughkeepsie, 1812. 24 p.
Cleveland, Grover. Invitation card to the Executive Mansion, February 6, [1883?].
Lawson, Thomas W. 2 leaflets attacking Harriman, Morgan and Wall Street. 3 p.
Constitution League. What the United States owes to the Negro vote. London, [ca.1901]. 4 p. An interview with John E. Milholland, chairman, Contitution League.

The Old Man's Story. An earnest protest against a tyrannical priesthood. [Bucyrus, Ohio, n.d.] 4 p. A protest by a hotel-keeper penalized by a court judgment "for no other reason only he was an 'Infidel'!"
Industry

Hartford and New Haven Rail Road Company. DS announcing a plan to issue 2000 shares of stock in order to extend the road to Springfield. 1843, Apr 13, Hartford. 2 p.; address on verso to Henry White, New Haven.

Ure, Andrew, analytical chemist. Report of the chemical analysis and examination of four samples of iron ore from Mr. Ross, Halifax, Nova Scotia,… London, 1847 Mar 25. 4 p. Concluding that the "proposed company, if well directed, is likely to realize a large fortune, and to pay liberal dividends to the Shareholders."
Central Railroad Company of New Jersey. Propositions...for the sale of its general mortgage bonds. New York, June 3, 1887. [8] p.
Patented products - Descriptions, advertisements
McCambridge & Co. Patent improved train brake. Three signed testimonials dated December 20,1866 and January 10, 1867. 1 p.
Harrison Boiler Works. Philadelphia, January 1870. Scale drawings of the Harrison Boiler, 50 horsepower, patented October 4, 1859. Front and side elevations. 1 sheet, torn.
C.C. Weston's Improved Patent Incubator. Orient Farm and Poultry Yards. Laurel, Maryland, 1877. A printed circular letter describing the workings of the incubator. 1 p.
Kendrick, Davis & Co. Lebanon, New Hampshire. Patent dust proof watch-keys. Trade card, illus. n.d.
Resorts, restaurants, travel brochures
White Star Line. United States and Royal Mail S.S. Britannic, from Liverpool to New York, September 7, 1882. Saloon passenger list. 4 p. illus.

Mecca Sanitarium, Titusville, Pa. Advertisement for the mineral springs, offering free treatment as well Liniment and its application. Illus. Removed from scrapbook. Partially obscured testimonials on verso. [1892]. 1 p.
Southern Pacific. Passenger Department, New Orleans, La.
The Old Absinthe House, by Judge L. O'Donnell./ New Orleans, March 26, 1894. 8 p. illus. 2 copies.
The French Opera. [New Orleans, 1894].14 p. illus.
The Yonkers Guide. May, 1899. Issued monthly by the Yonkers businessmen. 28 p. A directory of businesses and services.
The Crescent City and the New St. Charles. New Orleans, 1908. 32 p. illus. Description of the hotel, sightseeing guide, and schedule for the Mardi Gras.
The Patriots' Hall. Valley Forge. [4] p. 1909? illus. Fund raising brochure describing the newly built museum and library, and plans for future acquisitions.
Revere House. Breakfast bill of fare. 1 p. illus. [n.p., n.d.].
Amusements
Eden Musee. Programme of Views. American Cinematograph New York, April 1904. [4] p.
Advertisements - miscellaneous
The New York Dying and Printing Establishment. New York, 1837. 12 cm. Listing of services.
Elm City Poultry Yards and Pigeon Lofts. Charles H. Loomis, proprietor. New Haven, [ca.1875]. [4] p. illus. Essay on raising "fowls as a pleasure and profit." Description of birds, and prices.
Figurative Chameleon Top. Illustrated directions for spinning the top. 1 p. with 12 figures.
Charles H. Gaus, English and German, Prescription Pharmacy… Albany New York. With a chart of homoeopathic remedies and their use. [Broadside]
The Burton Holmes Travelogues. Boston, William W. Westcott, 1926. 6p. illus.
Advertisements--Clocks and watches
Nelson H. Brown. Hall clocks and mantel chimes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Boston, [n.d.]. [20] p. illus. including an illustration of the Olympia music box.

did.unittitle: Education--Riverview Academy, Poughkeepsie, N.Y.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Catalogue. 37 p. including a program of the course of study, an outline of the ideals of the school, and a listing of the students between 1867 and 1877.

did.unittitle: Children's literature -- Periodical. THE YOUNG CHRISTIAN SOLDIER. New York, Protestant Episcopal Church. Domestic missions. v.1, no.6, May 1868.
New York State: 5 announcement cards for a series of programs on American history from Station WGY. April, May 1929.
Advertisements - miscellaneous
The oriental base burning hot air furnace, for brick setting. Manufactured by Perry & Co. Oriental Stove Works, Albany, N.Y.,1868. 4p. illus. in red and black.
Doty's mandrake bitters!...C.C. Doty & Co., Proprietors, Bradford, Vt. n.d. 27x12cm. With seven testimonials.
Church finance: The Five Points Mission. New York, 1867. Appeal for funds for the Thanksgiving Dinner for children of the neighborhood.
Politics and government: Fremont, John Charles 1813-1890 Fremont ticket for presidential electors. n.p. [1864].
Advertisements - miscellaneous

H.H.Warner & Co. Warner's Safe Cure: Kidney and Liver, Brights Disease; Urinary Disorders…Rochester, New York. 1883. On obverse colored illustration of the battle of Tippecanoe with the legend, "After once using our 'Tippecanoe' you will use no nostrums nor preparations called 'bitters'. Try 'Tippecanoe' instead."

Hilles & Culberson, Barnesville, Ohio. Improved ball combination padlock. n.d. 1 p. illus. with description of the working of the new lock. Rights of the patent offered for sale by the American Patent Agency, Cincinnati, Ohio.
Jarvis B. Edson. Edson's Recording steam gauge and alarm. New York, [ca.l893]. 2 p. illus. with testimonial letters.
Wilbur L. Cross, breeder of high class and premium silver duckwing and red pile games. Gurleyville, Connecticut. [n.d.] Trade card.
Advertisements - clocks and watches
Nelson H. Brown. Hall clocks and mantel chimes. Boston, [n.d.]. [20] p. illus. including an illustration of the Olympia music box.

E.Ingraham Co. Ingraham watches and clocks. Catalogue No.39, 1918-1919. Bristol, Connecticut. 31 p. Illus. Photographs of the plant and office building as well as of watch and clock models, with prices.

E. Ingraham Co. Ingraham Watches and clocks. Colored supplement to Catalog No. 43, 1928-1929. Bristol, Connecticut. 12 p. illus. Drawings of the plant and of the founders of the company as well as of clocks.
Education

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Transferred to Carrington Family Papers, MS 130, Box 11.

did.unittitle: Carrington, Colonel Henry B."Military education in American colleges." Reprinted from the Wabash Magazine, March 1870. 15 p. Information on Wabash College, Crawfordsville, Indiana is included on the final leaf of the reprint.
Riverview Academy, Poughkeepsie, N.Y. Catalogue. [1877?] 37 p. including a program of the course of study, an outline of the ideals of the school, and a listing of the students between 1867 and 1877.

Children's literature: Work and Win. An interesting weekly for young America. New York, April 21, 1916. No. 907. Containing a complete story in the Fred Fearnot series. "Fred Fearnot and the rioters; or, backing up the sheriff," by Hal Standish. And other stories. 30 p.

Women: Second Congress of Women, 1874. Circular letter of Invitation. August 11, 1874. 6 p. brochure announcing the Congress to be held in Chicago, October 15-17,1874 and listing the topics to be discussed.

Resorts, restaurants, travel brochures: Topeka and its advantages. Topeka, 1888. 24p. Brochure emphasizing the development of Kansas in the preceding decade. "There is no city in the country which offers more inducements to those who seek a desirable home than the beautiful capital city of Kansas."
New York State: Miscellaneous legal and financial documents. 1790-1864. Some are printed forms filled in. Others are fragments. Also complete documents, MS with seals.

North Carolina: DS (printed form filled in), appointing Hugh W. Tener as Commissioner for the State of North Carolina in and for the State of Pennsylvania. Signed: Thomas Bragg, Governor. 13 October 1856. 1 p. with seal.
Church finance: Mann, Alexander/ TLS to "My dear Mr. Benton" thanking him for his contribution of $100 to the Missions. 1906 Mar 23, Trinity Church, Boston. 1 p.
Politics and government
U.S. Senate
Admission card.Impeachment of the president. Admit the bearer April 3rd 1869. Gallery. George T. Brown, Sergeantat-Arms. 2 copies
Democratic Party. New York State Convention. Brooklyn, Sept 24, 1896./ Delegate's badge mounted on red ribbon.
Republican National Committee: Have you been fooled? Soak the rich taxes really soak the poor … New York, The Committee, [1936?]. 8 p. illus.
Detroit Free Trade League. Membership form, with spaces for names and reprinting the "Creed" and "Constitution."
Jane Addams Chorus. Campaign songs. [Los Angeles, n.d.] 4 p.
National Recovery Administration. Stamp showing the eagle and the motto "We do our part."
Amusements

Dance invitation. Irving Calico Hop. Mr.----. Yourself and Lady are respectfully invited to attend a Calico Hop to be held at the Mansion House, Mauch Chunk, Pa. on Wednesday evening October 18th, 1871…[Printed on cloth.]
Publicity brochure. Miss Margaret Mather under the Management of J.M. Hill. [Buffalo, ca.1883] 12 p. illus.
Advertisements
Wm. Church, West Haven Ct. Paragon Washing Machine! Patented May 16, 1876 1 sheet, showing a working diagram of the machine. Printed in red and black.

Dr. Bull's Sarsparilla. Two pages on one leaf. Recto: The Capitol at Washington, with a list of the officers of the "Government of the United States, 1853" with an engraving of the capitol. Verso: Opinions of the press and advertising matter for Dr. Bull's Sarsaparilla.
W.W. Gale & Co. Electrical engineers and contractors. Leaflet with testimonials from New Haven firms.
Primus and Lovett. Brochure for Kerosene oil pressure stoves, torches, fire pots and lamps. New York, 1910. [12] p. illus. (no.8)
Broadsides
Sale by order of the Supreme Court of Pennsylvania...Ecton & Perkiomen Copper mine, Montgomery County, Pennsylvania, March 3, 1868. Attached a newspaper notice by auctioneer, James A. Freeman.
Assignee's Sale . September 22, 1886...titusville, Pennsylvania

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Offering three pieces of property for sale and a building on one of them

did.unittitle: [Wanted notice] $100.00 reward for William Henry Jackson..absconded night of October 29th with funds from Wells, Fargo & Company, ALbert Lea, Minnesota
Municipality of Shuniah, Ontario. Treasurer's Sale of Lands for Taxes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Listing of properties with locations, taxes, arears due. Supplement to the Thunder Bay Sentinel

did.unittitle: Newspapers and magazines
New York Herald , #771

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes the text of a message to both houses of Congress by James Madison, May 23.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Volume 1, number 2. With a short story by Warner Oliphant, a chapter of Barnaby Rudge , local and foreign political news, and an account of the Antarctic expedition of Captain James Clark Ross.

did.unittitle: New York Herald , #3619

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Volume X, Number 49. Political news and a substantial number of medical advertisements, both for medicines and doctors' and midwives' services.

did.unittitle: New Yorker , #96

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Volume IV, number 18. Poems, a chapter of a serial, religious meditations, an article on Chimborazo by Alexander von Humboldt, excerpt of an article from the Edinburgh Review and political news. On page 704 are the words and music for the song, "The Land of Dreams," by Samuel Lover.

did.unittitle: New York Herald , # 5051
Automobiles
Chrysler corporation. New worlds in engineering…Detroit, Mich., Chrysler corporation, [1940]/89, [7] p. illus.
Marmon Motor Car Company. Marmon Eight 69 Information Book. Indianapolis, Ind., Marmon
Motor Car Company, 1930. 31 p. illus.
General Motors. The new La Salle V-8… [n.p., General Motors, 1939] [30] p. illus

Mineral waters: Oxford Spring Water Depot. New Haven, Conn./ Advertising for Oxford Mineral Water, including leaflets, directions for use, trade cards, and pamphlets attesting to its chemical composition and its use by doctors. One pamphlet titled, "Oxford Spring Water, Nature's Remedy for all Disorders of the Blood…" has the Hebrew word for remedy at the head of title.
Great Britain - Travel memorabilia: Miscellaneous ship journals, menus, programs from the William Graham Sumner Papers
Inventions
The Pen and the Lever. Washington, E.P. Hudson & Co. v.1, no.5, Jan 30, 1856 [Periodical. Uncut pages]
Whitworth, Joseph

On the advantages and economy of maintaining a high degree of cleanliness in roads and streets; with an account of the construction and operation of the street-sweeping machine. Manchester, John Harrison and Son. 39 p. illus. (Excerpt minutes of proceedings of the Institution of Civil Engineers.)
Smith, William Harrold
Patent hermetic process of preserving wood in contact with earth. Chicago, Tribune Company, 1868. 16 p. illus.
Inventor's Guide and Advertiser. Washington, Clayton and Hervey [Periodical]
"From Clement & Bloodgood, dealers in Dry Goods/ Groceries, hardward and house furnishing goods. Broadway, Flushing, L.I.",[Broadside. Possibly intended as a sheet of wrapping paper.]
"Questions on geography." [n.p., H.A. Salisbury, Printer, n.d.][Broadside] A catechism on geography concluding with a series of questions on the Erie Canal, and a poem on the Sabbath School.
The Subway Sun. New York (City), Interborough Rapid Transit Co.[Broadside]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Volume 3, Number 38. Contains an excerpt from the World , Sept. 26, 1920 arguing that the five cent fare is too low.

did.unittitle: Held, John A., Jr. , 1889-1958. Total Eclipse of the Sun, Wednesday, August 31, 1932 . New Haven, The new haven Railroad, [1932]. Poster [lithographed] in red, blue, yellow and white. 105x71 cm. 2 copies. removed from the David Peck Todd Papers, Mss 496B.
Sports: Alexander, Fred B. How to play lawn tennis. New York, American Sports Publishing Company, 1914. 49 p. illus. (Spalding's Athletic Library. Group IV No.157)
Trade cards
Benham & Whitney. Importers and dealers in Hardware... New York. 2 copies
Crocker, Hall & Stow. Fancy goods... New York. 2 copies
Phelps, Ralph
Resorts, restaurants, travel brochures: Munnatawket House, Fisher's Island, N.Y. With engraving of the house. 1 p. leaflet.
Advertisements
International Radio Telegraph Company. X-Ray Division. The International Auto-Ray Dental Unit. [Pittsburgh, 1919.] 8 p. illus.
Brooks Brothers. A chronicle recording one hundred twenty-five years … 1818-1943. New York, Brooks Brothers, 1943. 61 p. illus.
"Enlightenment through exposure. Televisions's role as a mature instrument for the Public good," reprinted from Television Magazine, January 1952. 11 p. illus.

Education -- catalogue: Select Classical School, Morristown, N.J. Wilbert W. Perry, Principal. Prospectus, 1872-1873. 4 p. With a testimonial from Noah Porter, President of Yale College, June 17, 1872.

Politics and government -- Campaign literature, 1872: For president, 1872, Geo. Francis Train. Equal justice to all. Favors to Friends alone... New York, J.W. Nichols, [1872]. With photograph pasted on.
Amusements
"See the real German Battle Plane just at it was in the war... [Coral Gables, Fla., ca. 1920] [Advertising card, 3 copies]
Bootlegger and speakeasy cards for establishments in New York and Boston, ca. 1930-1933. 8 cards.
Religious literature: Protestant Episcopal Book Society. One resting place. Philadelphia, The Society , n.d. 7 p.
Financial documents
Eagle Fire Company of New York: Two fire insurance policies issued to Dyer White for a house on Orange Street, New Haven. 1806, 1808.
Pomroy, Joseph H., carriage manufacturer: Bill to "Mr. Walton," April 9, 1870. New York

Festivals: Fairbanks Post No. 17, Department of Michigan, G.A.R.. Memorial Day. Record of its observance...with addresses of Gen. L.S. Trowbridge and Rev. E.L. Rexford. Detroit, W.S. Ostler's Power Presses, 1882. 32 p. With signature on title page: L.S.T.
Campaign literature
16 items of pro-Hoover literature from the presidential campaign of 1928.
1 envelope stamped, "Nixon in '64" sent in 1961.
Adams, Francis M, collector
University of Cambridge, Massachusetts: Order of excercises for commencement... Cambridge, University Press, 1818. 4 p.
Prosody. [n.p., 1835] 2 p. on one leaf. The rules of prosody in Latin and Greek. Francis M. Adams, Feb 12, 1835 written in ink on the first page.
...Appendix. Terminations of Substantives... [n.p., 1835]. 8 p. Latin declensions. Francis M. Adams, 183? printed across the top. Page torn.
Valentine in cut-work paper, with the initials F.M.A. and the date, 1825, in ink.
Printed form from Charleston College. 1 p.
Emblem of the Magnolia Division No. 119 S. of T., Gloucester, Mass.
Advertisement: "Oratory and music in the Church St. church..." New Haven, Conn., Palladium Office Print., 1840
Infants - Care and hygiene
How to keep the baby well. New York, Department of Health, 1911. 36 x 20 cm. illus. Instructions on the recto. List of Infants' milk stations in Manhattan on verso.[Placard]
Regole d'Igiene per la salute dei bambini . Boston, Lega per la coltivazione della salute, [ca.1909-1912]. [Placard 35x25 cm.]

International Grenfell Association: 57 TLS by Alberta Morbio Pruett written to her mother, Rosa Sutro Morbio and other members of her family while working as a nurse with the Grenfell expedition in Lewis Bay, Labrador. 1924 Jun 1-1925 Jun 21.

Theater programs: The last visit to America. Sarah Bernhardt. Season 1910-1911. Joan of Arc as represented by Mme. Sarah Bernhardt and company. Under the Direction of Wm. F. Connor. New York, F. Rullman, [1910]. 23p. Autographed: Sarah Bernhardt.
Railroads
New York, New Haven and Hartford Railroad. Timetable. New York ...New Haven. New Canaan Branch. October 14, 1934
N.Y. Central and Hudson River Railroad. Ticket stub for a trip from Little Falls to Amsterdam. Oct 13, 1882.
Boston: United States Hotel. Boston. Engraving.[ca. 1890?]. 9x14 cm.
Humor: Miscellaneous newspaper clippings with jokes, humorous anecdotes, etc. 1883.
Newspapers: Washington, D.C. Daily Evening Star. Receipt for a three months subscription. (Printed form filled in.) November 25, 1854.
Politics and government
Cleveland, Grover, Pres. U.S., 1837-1903/Campaign pin in gilt metal with the photograph of Cleveland set in. n.d.
Election campaign, 1948 - Republican Party/Campaign buttons for Dewey and Warren. 4 items.
Travel brochures: This week in Indianapolis. Indianapolis, Convention and publicity Bureau, October 1933.
U.S. United States Savings Bonds Division
A portfolio containing samples of booklets used in the division's direct mail campaign to promote the sale of United States Savings Bonds.
Beach, Adilie
Autograph album with verses and sentiments inscribed to Adilie Beach. 1879 Apr, May, Mansfield, Pa.; 1916 Aug 6, Orlando, Fla. 1 v.

Women: A collection of pamphlet and leaflets issued by the Woman's Industrial Exhibition, 1912; National American Woman Suffrage Association, the Women's Trade Union League the Bell Telephone Company (on its women operators) and miscellaneous items relating to women.
Recipes: A collection of manuscript recipes, with two newspaper clippings.
Peary, Robert Edwin
Menu of the Annual Dinner of the Explorer's Club, Hotel Astor, New York. Autographed by Robert E. Peary on the verso.
Advertisements - Travel: Brochures, leaflets, postcards relating to trans-Atlantic travel
Railroads: Card with photographs of trains and stations of the Mohawk & Hudson River Railroad. 1916, New Haven
Education: Ms lesson book with exercises in penmanship, geometry and French. Included also are three pages of accounts in English and French kept by a jeweler
Commonplace books: Two commonplace books with excerpts of poetry and prose. One with a genealogy of the Benedict family.
Public health: Chicago. Dept. of Health. Quarantine notice for diptheria.
Consumers' League of the City of New York. Brochure on its Christmas shopping policy.
Advertisements
The Witchraft Advertiser. v.19, no.77 (January 1901). A complete magazine in which every item has a mention of Sapolio.
Advertisements for various services and products in the form of leaflets, brochers and cards. Included also are two trade cards. 14 items
Education - 19th century
Lists of spelling exercises. Embossed on Paper.
A composition on the Fourth of July pricked on paper.
Newport, Rhode Island
Brochure for the sale of property in Newport, with photographs of the city and environs., With newspaper clippings on the sale.
Artifacts
Cardboard pillbox from E. Hewitt & Co. Pharmacits of New Haven.
Folding waxed paper drinking cup.
Public health: Louisiana. State Board of Health/ Poster. "Typhoid fever can be prevented..." 1915. 48x32 cm.

Phrenology: Fowler, O.S. & L.N./ Phrenological chart. Presenting a synopsis of the science, and designed to accompany "Phronology proved, illustrated and applied;" by O.S. & L.N. Fowler, assisted by S. Kirkham. 60x49 cm.
Inspirational literature
The Trotty Veck Messengers. Saranac, N.Y.
Pamphlet entitled "The Old Family Coach: An American Game for a Large Party of Children"
Poetry: "Housekeeper's Rubaiyat," by Olive Green [n.d.]
Fraternal organizations
Two advertising palm cards, two admission tickets, and a Red Hand of Ulster ribbon and badge for the Pittsburgh Irish Protestant fraternal organization's balls and banquets.
